intro: Rhaphithamnus spinosus f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered spiny shrub, is a rare variant of the native Australian species Rhaphithamnus spinosus. It is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and clusters of white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
